summary.para: The DISPLAYCONFIG_DEVICE_INFO_TYPE enumeration specifies the type of display device info to configure or obtain through the or function.
Specifies the source name of the display device. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns the source name in the structure.
Specifies information about the monitor. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns info about the monitor in the structure.
Specifies information about the preferred mode of a monitor. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns info about the preferred mode of a monitor in the structure.
Specifies the graphics adapter name. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns the adapter name in the structure.
Specifies how to set the monitor. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigSetDeviceInfo uses info in the structure to force the output in a boot-persistent manner.
Specifies how to set the base output technology for a given target ID. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns base output technology info in the structure.
Supported by WDDM 1.3 and later user-mode display drivers running on Windows 8.1 and later.
Specifies the state of virtual mode support. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo returns virtual mode support information in the structure. Supported starting in Windows 10.

Specifies how to set the state of virtual mode support. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigSetDeviceInfo uses info in the structure to change the state of virtual mode support. Supported starting in Windows 10.
Specifies the current SDR white level for an HDR monitor. If the function is successful, DisplayConfigGetDeviceInfo return SDR white level info in the structure.
Supported starting in Windows 10 Fall Creators Update (Version 1709).
Forces this enumeration to compile to 32 bits in size. Without this value, some compilers would allow this enumeration to compile to a size other than 32 bits. You should not use this value.
